The world's population would continue to grow, leading to even more strain on resources and infrastructure.
The global economy would collapse as industries such as fossil fuels, agriculture, and transportation would be severely impacted.
The environment would be drastically altered, with ecosystems and habitats being destroyed or severely impacted.
The political and social systems of the world would be thrown into chaos, with countries struggling to adapt to the new reality.
The world would become a much colder and wetter place, leading to widespread famine, disease, and conflict.
